Comments_List: I learnt about many market failures in the difference developing countries
I learnt a great deal about how to apply economic concepts to developing states but also to all states in general.

Strengths: covers many topics 
Weakness: no in depth

Strengths
- Readings were very good. Really liked the selection, especially liked reading newspaper articles about the different topics in different contexts. 
- Liked using game theory to understand market dynamics. 

Weaknesses
- The final project did not seem to be very aligned with the class content. It ended up being more of an entrepreneurial pursuit (designing a business plan or thinking through an expansion ) rather than understanding the institutional context or the larger market dynamics. 
- Some overlap with State and Society. Repetitive for MBA students. 
- For those who have already working in development or in other countries -- which is most of the class -- much of the material was somewhat obvious and predictable. The class helped put some frameworks on these concepts, but the concepts themselves were not new news. 
- Little engagement with the class. I think would be better in smaller classroom, with more discussion between students
I will recommend it to people who begin to be interested in development works but not people who are already working in the field.
It helps you to think a little outside the neoclassical econ cannon.
No -- the prof didnt inspire confidence, found much of the material to be rather obvious if you've worked in development before.
